artist: Artist: Utagawa Kunisada; Publisher: Iseya Kanekichi; Carver: Yokogawa Takejirō
creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: portrait of man with blueish face, wearing a blue kimono with wavy brown and black stripes, with red rivulets of blood running down his shoulders; man looks down toward LRC; man holds five multicolored striped sticks in his PR hand; night landscape behind figure with trees and grass blowing in wind; mountain in ULQ; pink square cartouche and red rectangular cartouche with text in URC
inscription:
{Yasukata no bōrei} (character\'s name) | Nakatsukasa\'s poem: {Akikaze no / Fuku ni tsukete mo / Towanu kana / Hagi no ha nara ba / Otwashi te ma shi}
(The autumnal wind / Blows but brings me no message- / Yet that listless breeze, / Where I a beckoning reed, would whisper / In the rusting of my leaves.) (Translated by Edwin A. Cranston)
markings: date seal: ne jūichi 子十一 (Rat 11); censor seals: Watanabe 渡邊, Mera 米良; publisher\'s seal: {Isekane}; carver\'s seal: Yokogawa hori Take
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The Visual Parody of the Thirty-Six Selected Poets (Mitate sanjūrokkasen no uchi 見立三十六歌撰之内)
signed: in toshidama cartouche: 豊國画 {Toyokuni ga}
title: Nakatsukasa's Poem and the Ghost of Yasukata
